holidays.name: National Cereal Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the crunchy, sweet, and sometimes surprisingly nutritious breakfast staple that has fueled generations.
holidays.origin: Invented by cereal lovers and food enthusiasts who wanted to honor their favorite morning meal on this date.
holidays.funFact: More than 300 brands of cereal are available in the US alone, making it one of the most diverse food products! Also, March 7 is a perfect prelude to spring breakfast vibes.

holidays.name: Alexander Graham Bell Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the birthday of Alexander Graham Bell, the inventor of the telephone and a pioneer in communication technologies.
holidays.origin: Officially recognized to honor Bell's contributions to modern telecommunication.
holidays.funFact: Bell was also deeply interested in teaching the deaf and worked on numerous inventions related to speech and hearing.

holidays.name: Ellis Island Family History Day

holidays.origin: Created by genealogical and immigrant heritage organizations to celebrate multicultural roots.
holidays.funFact: Over 12 million immigrants passed through Ellis Island, making it a symbol of hope and new beginnings for many families.
